title: Shabir Isoufi
text:
Shabir Isoufi (born 9 March 1992) is an Afghan <a href="association%20football">football</a> coach and former player who works as an assistant coach for the <a href="Afghanistan%20national%20football%20team">Afghanistan national team</a>.
He played for Dutch clubs <a href="Feyenoord">Feyenoord</a>, <a href="SBV%20Excelsior">Excelsior</a>, <a href="FC%20Dordrecht">Dordrecht</a>, <a href="Telstar%20%28football%20club%29">Telstar</a>, <a href="BVV%20Barendrecht">Barendrecht</a>, <a href="ASWH">ASWH</a> and <a href="SC%20Feyenoord">SC Feyenoord</a> as a <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a>, and also represented <a href="Afghanistan%20national%20football%20team">Afghanistan</a> at international level.
Playing career.
Club career.
Isoufi played club football in the Netherlands for <a href="Feyenoord">Feyenoord</a>, <a href="SBV%20Excelsior">Excelsior</a>, <a href="FC%20Dordrecht">Dordrecht</a>, <a href="Telstar%20%28football%20club%29">Telstar</a> and <a href="BVV%20Barendrecht">Barendrecht</a>. In June 2015 Shabir signed a contract with <a href="Hoofdklasse">Hoofdklasse</a> club <a href="ASWH">ASWH</a>. He moved to <a href="SC%20Feyenoord">SC Feyenoord</a> for the 2017–18 season.
International career.
He made three appearances for the Netherlands at the <a href="2009%20FIFA%20U-17%20World%20Cup">2009 FIFA U-17 World Cup</a>.
He earned seven caps for the <a href="Afghanistan%20national%20football%20team">Afghanistan senior team</a> in 2015, scoring once.
Coaching career.
Isoufi graduated with his UEFA B diploma on 22 May 2018. After gaining his diploma, Isoufi was appointed as the assistant coach of the <a href="Afghanistan%20national%20football%20team">Afghan national football team</a>.
Personal life.
In 2011, Isoufi was the highest paid athlete from Afghanistan with an annual salary of $80,000 (<a href="USD">USD</a>).
